Job_Description: A technical database engineer is a professional who specializes in designing, implementing, and maintaining complex database systems. They are responsible for ensuring the performance, security, and reliability of databases used by organizations to store and manage data. Technical database engineers have a deep understanding of database management systems and are skilled in programming languages such as SQL, Python, and Java. They work closely with other technical teams to ensure that the database infrastructure is optimized for the needs of the organization, and they may also provide guidance on database-related projects and initiatives.
Job_Responsibility: job responsibilities of a technical database engineer may include Designing, developing, and implementing databases for various applications and systems.Ensuring data security, integrity, and availability by implementing proper backup, recovery, and maintenance procedures.Monitoring and optimizing database performance, and resolving issues related to data access and retrieval.Collaborating with software developers, system administrators, and other stakeholders to integrate databases with applications and systems.

Job_Description: A UI/UX (User Interface/User Experience) designer is responsible for designing and creating engaging and effective interfaces for software and web applications. This includes designing the layout, visual design, and interactivity of the user interface.
Job_Responsibility: Collaborating with cross-functional teams: UI/UX designers often work closely with other teams, including product management, engineering, and marketing, to ensure that the user interface is aligned with business and technical requirements. You will need to be able to effectively communicate your design ideas and gather feedback from other team members.
